properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 5 at 3:16PM PST until January 6 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...MORE MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT FOR THE
CASCADES...NORTHEAST WASHINGTON...BLUE MOUNTAINS...
AND THE IDAHO PANHANDLE...

.One round of snow will occur through tonight for the Cascades and
Idaho Panhandle with moderate accumulations near the Cascade
crest. A stronger storm arrives Monday with snow expanding to
include many areas of Eastern Washington and North Idaho with
moderate to heavy snow accumulations expected.

* WHAT...Additional 5 to 10 inches through tonight near the
Cascade Crest. An additional 1 to 2 feet of heavy wet snow
expected in the mountains near the Cascade crest Monday and
Monday evening. Valley snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches for
upper portions of Wenatchee River Valley and the upper Methow
Valley including Plain, Lake Wenatchee, and Mazama.

* WHERE...The Cascade Crest including Highway 2 from Coles Corner
to Stevens Pass.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, through 4 AM PST Monday.
For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM to 10 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected through tonight
with periods of moderate to heavy mountain snow. Increasingly
heavy snow will have the potential to produce dangerous
conditions Monday into Monday evening with snowfall rates up to
3 inches per hour.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM PST MONDAY FOR THE CASCADE CREST INCLUDING HIGHWAY 2 BETWEEN COLES CORNER AND STEVENS PASS
